result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Mathew Jahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250.00 to Natalie H.  To be paid first.

After restitution is paid, pay DNA surcharge, plus costs and disbursements. 
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:   To be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Faiure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Follow any treatment recommended.

No contact with Lisa F., Danielle S., Jenna S., Lisa F., Natalie H. or Timothy H. or any of their residences.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendasnt by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs.  Take as prescribed and only for as long as deemed reasonably medically necessary.
No alcohol.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample ordered in 14CF5047.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Mathew Jahn in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Michael Mathew Jahn in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel's request for adjournment was granted by the Court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Michael Mathew Jahn in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Michael Mathew Jahn in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 3/20/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Michael Mathew Jahn not in court, in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived her client's appearance; requested a short adjournment of the plea and sentencing as she had just received additional discovery materials.  Court granted defense request and ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date. Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Mathew Jahn in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Michael Mathew Jahn in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Court appearance in Room 113 Safety Building on 1/22/15 @ 8:30am
